Collect file paths for every CSV in the 'State MSA Fraud and Other Data' directory and in the 'State MSA Identity Theft Data' directory.
For each Fraud CSV: (a) read the file, (b) drop the first row and last four rows that hold meta‐data / totals, (c) take the first remaining row as the header, (d) drop that header row from the data
Convert the '# of Reports' column from a comma-separated string to an integer.
For each Identity-Theft CSV perform the same cleaning steps
Map Metropolitan Area → to number of identity-theft reports and fraud reports respectively.

Iterate over every metro in the identity-theft dictionary; for metros that also appear in the fraud dictionary compare the two counts.  If any metro has identity-theft reports > fraud reports, print that metro name, print True, and stop the search.
Count and print the number of metros that appear in both dictionaries (overlap/intersection).
